3766879773.excerpt: In the 1880s, a newspaper owner named Jasper Meek was looking out the window of his print shop in Coshocton, Ohio, when he saw a young girl drop her school books. As the story now goes, the sight inspired him to fashion a burlap bag in which people could carry books.

3214445639.given_title: 10 basic advanced IC packaging terms to know
3214445639.resolved_title: 10 basic advanced IC packaging terms to know
3214445639.excerpt: Advanced IC packaging is a prominent technology highlight of the “More than Moore” arena. At a time when chip scaling is becoming more difficult and expensive at each node, engineers are putting multiple chips in advanced packages as an alternative to chip scaling.

2.caption: Here is a schematic of a 2.5D package. Image: Research Gate

3.caption: This 3D package cross-section shows the use of Cu TSVs for vertical interconnection between Si chips. Image: Research Gate

4.caption: A chiplet-based system is made of multiple chiplets on an interposer. Image: Cadence Design Systems

5.caption: In this example of FOWLP, the silicon flip chip is embedded into the glass substrate, and the RDL fans out over the chip to a through-glass via. Image: Samtec

6.caption: These are some of the technology building blocks for heterogeneous integration. Image: ASE Group

7.caption: HBM-based packaging stacks memory dies on top of each other and connects them using TSVs to create more I/Os and bandwidth. Image: SK Hynix

8.caption: This illustration shows a typical implementation of a system-partitioning interposer. Image: Yole Développement

9.caption: These diagrams show an integrated package using a redistribution layer. Image: Fujitsu

10.caption: In TSV packaging, DRAM chips are ground down, pierced, and connected with electrodes. Image: Samsung Electronics
